content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No new structures have been successfully placed on the map. Multiple attempts to deploy a Lab at position (0.5, 2.5) were made but none succeeded due to inventory shortages and cascading crafting errors. In parallel, the agent accessed existing furnace structures—an iron furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) and a copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)—to process ores into plates. These furnaces were used for smelting operations but were not constructed by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
• API Usage Errors for Entity Retrieval
 – Avoid using unsupported keywords or argument formats when calling get_entities. The function was invoked with a keyword argument “radius” and later with multiple positional arguments, both of which lead to signature mismatches. Always confirm the correct calling convention per the API documentation.
 
• Lab Placement and Iteration Mistakes
 – Before attempting to place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5), verify that the Lab item exists in the inventory to prevent placement failures.
 – Ensure that functions returning collections (e.g., the list of labs) are validated for None before iterating over them.

• Lab Crafting Supply Chain Shortcomings
 – Multiple crafting errors indicate missing sub-ingredients for Lab production (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables). Ensure that all production chains are complete by securing adequate base resources (e.g., iron-plates and copper-plates) and establishing the necessary smelting or assembly capabilities before attempting to craft complex items like Labs.
